Key Match Events: The Thunder went on a 9-2 run with Gilgeous-Alexander on the bench to regain control of the game.
The Thunder led 93-81 when Gilgeous-Alexander returned, and Oklahoma City led 103-87 when he went to the bench for good with 2:46 remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: Oklahoma City has won all four of its games by at least 12 points.
The Spurs shot just 41.2% from the field and struggled to manufacture shots for their young star.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder made 17 of 41 3-pointers while the Spurs made 12 of 36.
Victor Wembanyama was held to six points on 1-for-5 shooting in his matchup with Holmgren.
Others: Up next, the Spurs visit the Jazz on Thursday, and the Thunder visit the Trail Blazers on Friday.
